en.modalsubtext: At the moment, the site is still not ready. Clicking on "OK" will take you to the English version.
en.havefun: What language do you want to have fun in?
en.tjppd: Long gone are quiet nights in watching the same old TV shows â€“ The Jackbox Party Pack is here! Experience five fun games in one great pack â€“ giving you the perfect excuse for rounding up friends, family and fellow gamers for a few hours of gaming delight â€“ whatever the day, whatever the occasion. Youâ€™re gonna need more than one party for this.
en.screenblocker: Unfortunately, this screen scale isn"t supported!
en.jackboxbaltic: Jackbox Baltic United is the site where we upload unofficial Estonian, Latvian and Lithuanian translations for the games of Jackbox Games, known for being the creators of the Jackbox Party Pack. We are just starting our way into localization of games, so you can help us by joining our team on the discord server!
en.aboutjgd: Jackbox Games is a small game production studio from Chicago (Illinois). The most famous franchise - You Don't Know Jack - has been released since 1995, and even existed as a TV show. Being a part of Jellyvision, in 2013 the company separated and was named Jackbox Games. In addition to The Jackbox Party Pack franchise, a variety of games are released, for example - Quiplash, Fibbage, Trivia Murder Party.
en.contd: If you have a question, a suggestion or just want to chat, the best way to get in touch is via:
en.discorddi: Jackbox Baltic United is the site where we upload unofficial Estonian, Latvian, and Lithuanian translations for the games of Jackbox Games, known for being the creators of the Jackbox Party Pack. We are just starting our way into game localization, so you can help us by joining our team on the Discord server!
en.howtoplayd: So, you want to play Jackbox Games! Great choice.
en.s1t1: Getting started is easy! For Jackbox games, your phone or tablet is the controller and up to 8 people can play. Sometimes more! The main action of the game happens on your TV (or wherever you launched the game), but players use their own mobile devices to input answers and make choices.
en.s1t2: All Jackbox games are rated T For Teen. Many games have a family-friendly mode that can be turned on in the gameâ€™s settings menu, which brings the game closer to an E10+ rating!
en.s1t3: Remember, only one person in your group needs to own a Jackbox product in order to host the game.
en.s2h1: LAUNCH THE GAME AND GRAB A MOBILE DEVICE
en.s2t1: Once you launch and pick the game you want to play, youâ€™ll see a four-letter room code in the lobby.
en.s2t2: To join, each player uses their phone or tablet and goes to jackbox.tv, then choose the language you are playing in, using whatever web browser you normally use.
en.s3h1: ENTER THE ROOM CODE AT JACKBOX.TV
en.s3t1: Once youâ€™re there, enter that four-letter room code on your mobile device.
en.s3t2: Then, enter whatever name you want to use in the game. Hit the PLAY button, and you should be connected!
en.s3t3: In The Jackbox Party Pack 9, you can also connect by pointing your phone camera at the QR code in the lobby and then following the URL that appears.
en.s3t4: If you get disconnected during a game, refresh your browser. This fixes most disconnects!
en.s4t1: The very first person to connect is the VIP. When everyone who wants to play is connected and ready, the VIP can start the game from their device.
en.s4t2: If youâ€™ve enabled the â€œStart Game from Controller Onlyâ€ setting (in the gameâ€™s settings menu), youâ€™ll need to press the button shown onscreen to begin.
en.s4t3: NOTE: â€œEverybodyâ€™s Inâ€ or â€œStart Gameâ€ will only appear on the screen if you have enough players to begin a game.
en.q1: Why do I get a black screen after installing my translation?
en.a1: If the screen goes black after installing the translation, it means that your version is pirated. Pirated versions are often outdated and do not have the same file structure as current versions. We can only encourage you to get a legitimate version.
en.q2: I want to play. Where do I get the room code?
en.a2:
There are two options:

  • to start yourself â€“ you need to buy the game on Steam, install our translation and then proceed according to the manual.
  • to find someone else's game â€” you DON't need to buy and install the game, just find out the room code and go through jackbox.tv, then watch the gameplay where you got the code.

Once again: the purchased and installed game is needed only by the one who starts (the host).
He and the rest of the participants join the game from their browsers (phones, tablets or computers) via Jackbox.TV, you don't need to install anything else.
en.q3: I bought a Party Pack on the Epic Games Store, how do I download the translation?
en.a3: Apologies, but we are currently doing translations of the Steam version.
en.q4: I found an error in one of the translations. Where can I report it?
en.a4:
In the ğŸ”¹ï¸™mistakes channel of the Discord server.
If possible, do not skimp on the details. This makes it easier to find the problem.
en.tjpsd: Jackbox Party Starter is an indispensable party game! This pack contains three updated games: Quiplash 3, Tee K.O. and Trivia Murder Party 2.
en.tjppstext:
Our translation is released for Windows OS based version of Steam (+ Humble/Fanatical). Other platforms (Epic Games) have not been tested.
On this page you can get a modification that adds a language to the game. Please note that not all games are translated and there may be errors or inaccuracies. However you can help us by entering the Discord Server.
To download the translation you need to have the game on Steam. We do not support piracy and will not help!
en.tjpp3d: The threequel to the party game phenomenon features the deadly quiz show Trivia Murder Party, the say-anything sequel Quiplash 2, the surprising survey game Guesspionage, the t-shirt slugfest Tee K.O., and the sneaky trickster game Fakinâ€™ It.
en.l1p: We (hereinafter referred to as JBU) strive to create high-quality translations of The Jackbox Party Pack franchises (hereinafter referred to as the game) for your enjoyment and convenience. Our goal is to make these games accessible to everyone who does not speak the original language of Jackbox Games (hereinafter referred to as the developer). However, we want to openly and honestly declare our disclaimer and the terms of use for our translations.
en.l2p: JBU is not an official representative of the game developers and does not have their permission for translation. Our translations are a creative effort by participants and are based on their skills and knowledge. Please remember that we do not have any official status with respect to these games.
en.l3p: During the translation and adaptation process, errors or discrepancies may occur. We make every effort to ensure the quality of our translations, but we cannot guarantee their flawless accuracy. Please understand that some issues may arise.
en.l4p: We strongly disapprove of the pirated distribution of games. Our translations are intended only for users who own original copies of the games. Please comply with the law and respect the intellectual property of the game developers.
en.l5p: Our team may periodically update the translations to improve quality or correct errors. We do not commit to supporting outdated versions of the translations.
en.l6p: By using our translations, you do so at your own risk. Risks include compatibility and stability, legality, updates, and support. We are not responsible for any damage that may occur as a result of using our translations.
en.l7p: We hope that our efforts will help you enjoy the games in your native language, but we ask you to adhere to the above-mentioned terms and understand that we are not official representatives of the developers. Thank you for your support and understanding.
